Detailed Description

An OLVColumn knows which aspect of an object it should present.

The column knows how to:

  • extract its aspect from the row object
  • convert an aspect to a string
  • calculate the image for the row object
  • extract a group "key" from the row object
  • convert a group "key" into a title for the group

For sorting to work correctly, aspects from the same column must be of the same type, that is, the same aspect cannot sometimes return strings and other times integers.

Definition at line 1812 of file ObjectListView.cs.

string BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.GetStringValue ( object  rowObject  ) 

For a given row object, return the string representation of the value shown in this column.

For aspects that are string (e.g. aPerson.Name), the aspect and its string representation are the same. For non-strings (e.g. aPerson.DateOfBirth), the string representation is very different.

Parameters:
rowObject 
Returns:

string BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.ValueToString ( object  value  ) 

Convert the aspect object to its string representation.

If the column has been given a ToStringDelegate, that will be used to do the conversion, otherwise just use ToString(). Nulls are always converted to empty strings.

Parameters:
value The value of the aspect that should be displayed
Returns:
A string representation of the aspect

Definition at line 1906 of file ObjectListView.cs.

Referenced by BrightIdeasSoftware.ObjectListView.BuildGroups().

void BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.MakeGroupies ( T[]  values,
string[]  descriptions 
)

Install delegates that will group the columns aspects into progressive partitions. If an aspect is less than value[n], it will be grouped with description[n]. If an aspect has a value greater than the last element in "values", it will be grouped with the last element in "descriptions".

Parameters:
values Array of values. Values must be able to be compared to the aspect (using IComparable)
descriptions The description for the matching value. The last element is the default description. If there are n values, there must be n+1 descriptions.
this.salaryColumn.MakeGroupies( new UInt32[] { 20000, 100000 }, new string[] { "Lowly worker", "Middle management", "Rarified elevation"});

Property Documentation

string BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.AspectName [get, set]

The name of the property or method that should be called to get the value to display in this column. This is only used if a ValueGetterDelegate has not been given.

string BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.AspectToStringFormat [get, set]

This format string will be used to convert an aspect to its string representation.

This string is passed as the first parameter to the String.Format() method. This is only used if ToStringDelegate has not been set. "{0:C}" to convert a number to currency

Definition at line 1646 of file ObjectListView.cs.

bool BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.UseInitialLetterForGroup [get, set]

Group objects by the initial letter of the aspect of the column.

One common pattern is to group column by the initial letter of the value for that group. The aspect must be a string (obviously).

Definition at line 1662 of file ObjectListView.cs.

bool BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.IsTileViewColumn [get, set]

Get/set whether this column should be used when the view is switched to tile view.

Column 0 is always included in tileview regardless of this setting. Tile views do not work well with many "columns" of information, 2 or 3 works best.

If this is set, AspectName is ignored.

AspectToStringConverterDelegate BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.AspectToStringConverter [get, set]

The delegate that will be used to translate the aspect to display in this column into a string.

If this value is set, ValueToStringFormat will be ignored.

Definition at line 1704 of file ObjectListView.cs.

ImageGetterDelegate BrightIdeasSoftware.OLVColumn.ImageGetter [get, set]

This delegate is called to get the image selector of the image that should be shown in this column. It can return an int, string, Image or null.

This delegate can use these return value to identify the image:

  • null or -1 -- indicates no image
  • an int -- the int value will be used as an index into the small image list
  • a String -- the string value will be used as a key into the small image list
  • an Image -- the Image will be drawn directly

Definition at line 1723 of file ObjectListView.cs.
